intro: Dasymalla terminalis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dasymalla, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
